_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:04:27 using v2.1
title: How does physician density per population compare internationally and how has it changed?
analysis_commentary:
The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) have estimated physician and nurse density (head count per 1,000 population) in several countries.

Physician density has increased since 1993 for all countries chosen for review from the OECD report (see "about this data" link for the selection process). In 1993, the United Kingdom had the lowest physician density of the nine countries with 1.7 physicians per 1,000 people. By 2011, however, it was fourth (of the seven countries that also had comparable data at that time) with 2.8 physicians per 1,000 people.
